user.title: 1/3 Basic Configuration
user.description:
Creates a scene which, when activated, lights your room based on the sun elevation. The scene is best matched with an automation that triggers the scene every 5 minutes or so.

**Only supports native Home Assistant Scenes** (Ie. not scenes from the Hue integration).

_All settings can be changed later._

data_description.area_id: Which area the scene will be assigned to
data_description.display_scenes_combined: If on, configure 3 scenes in the next step. If off, configure 5

scenes.title: 2/3 Scenes Configuration
scenes.description:
Match solar events with a scene. At the time of the event the scene will be fully activated, then transition towards the scene matched with the next event.

_Selectors only show **native Home Assistant scenes** assigned to the selected area._

data.scene_dusk_minimum_time_of_day: Earliest time for triggering the dusk scene

data_description.scene_noon_name: When the sun is at its highest point
data_description.scene_dusk_minimum_time_of_day: To avoid lights dimming too much, too early

nightlights.title: 3/3 Nightlights Configuration
nightlights.description:
If you want to configure a dedicated nightlights scene, you can do that here. This is completely optional - you can skip this step if you don't need nightlights functionality.

**Note:** Due to limitations in Home Assistant, it's not possible to clear values once stored.

data_description.nightlights_boolean_name: Input boolean that triggers nightlights mode instead of normal extrapolation
data_description.nightlights_scene_name: Scene to activate when nightlights mode is triggered
